intro: Acronychia dimorphocalyx, commonly known as the two-leaved acronychia, is a small to medium-sized tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and small, elliptical leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, round fruits that split open to release seeds. It is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions.
